problem.markdown:
>> NMR technique uses: () Microwave (x) Radio waves () Infrared radiation () Gamma radiation
>> The x-axis in a NMR spectrum is (x) ratio of the magnetic field strength in ppm () frequency in cm-1 () mass to charge ratio (m/z) () Absorbance
>> A shielded proton is the one which experiences: (x) More electron density and more magnetic field strength () Less electron density and less magnetic field strength () More electron density and less magnetic field strength () Less electron density and more magnetic field strength
>> The internal reference standard used in NMR experiments is: (x) tetramethylsilane () deuterated solvents () Nor-Leucine () 2,2-diphenyl-1-picrylhydrazyl
>> The TMS (tetramethylsilane) peak value is assigned at: () δ = 0.05 () δ = 0.11 () δ = 1.00 (x) δ = 0.00
>> The number of hydrogens are calculated from peak integration by studying the () Intensity of the peak (x) Area under the curve () Position of the peak () frequency used
>> The most common deuterated solvent used for polar compounds is: () DMF (x) DMSO () Chroloform () Water
>> The 13C NMR spectrum gives information about: () Number of equivalent Carbon atoms (x) Number of non- equivalent Carbon atoms () Number of equivalent hydrogen atoms () Number of non- equivalent hydrogen atoms
>> The number of peaks tells you: (x) the number of different proton environments () the general environment of the protons () number of protons atoms on the adjacent atom () number of protons in each environment
>> In a NMR spectrum the peak multiplicity gives: () the number of different proton environments () the general environment of the protons (x) number of protons atoms on the adjacent atom () number of protons in each environment
